summary: This document is a series of Bureau of Prisons count sheets and related forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated July 31, 2019, and August 1, 2019. It records inmate headcounts by housing unit, out-count forms, and specific inmate assignments, including one inmate assigned to 'HOSP' for 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG' and another for transport. The documents are routine prison administrative records from the period shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Rodriguez
persons.context: Inmate listed on an Inmate Roster with registration number 86831-054, assigned to 'HOSP' (hospital) with a work/suicide watch or unassigned designation on July 31, 2019.

persons.name: Gama-Pineda
persons.context: Inmate listed on an Inmate Roster with registration number 85918-054, assigned to 'HOSP' (hospital) with a work/suicide watch or unassigned designation on August 1, 2019.

persons.name: Harrison
persons.context: Inmate listed on an Inmate Roster with registration number 57084-056, assigned as a 'TWN DRIVER' (likely transport) on August 1, 2019.

events.title: MCC Inmate Count and Hospital Assignment
events.description: Routine inmate count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. Inmate Rodriguez is recorded as assigned to the hospital with a 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG' designation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: These are routine Bureau of Prisons administrative count sheets from the MCC New York dated July 31 and August 1, 2019.
The documents show inmate counts by housing unit (e.g., B-A, G-N, H-A) with totals around 763 inmates.
Specific inmates are noted with hospital assignments for 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG', indicating suicide watch protocols were in use at the facility.
The dates place these documents in the immediate timeframe before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
The documents are standard prison forms for tracking inmate location and status, not specific to Epstein.
